p: We obtained the same tendency with Ocimum basilicum. In fact, our results are in good agreement with those of Hussain et al., [ 30] who reported that linalool was the main component in O. basilicum EO grown in Pakistan. Also, Gurbuz et al. [ 31] found that linalool (41.2%) was the main compound, identified in the hydrodistilled O. basilicum EO from Turkey. While, Purkayastha and Nath [ 32] reported that the major components in O. basilicum EO from northeast India were limonene, camphor, and b-selinene.
